response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "The purpose of this measure is to establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the Second and Fifth Circuits. [CHUNK_1] The program is intended to acknowledge the distinct pathways that lead women into the criminal justice system and address their individualized needs. [CHUNK_2] The measure also requires the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study to establish a blueprint for a women's court pilot program in the Third Circuit. [CHUNK_3]",
  "appropriations": "The committee report from the Committee on Finance does not specify any appropriation amounts. [CHUNK_5] While a previous committee report requested specific funding, your Committee on Finance is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, without inserting appropriation figures. [CHUNK_5] The bill is recommended to pass Third Reading with appropriations remaining unspecified. [CHUNK_6]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The provided committee report does not contain any information on assumptions or methodology used for financial projections. [CHUNK_5] The report notes that the Committee received comments on this measure from the Judiciary and Department of Health, but does not detail any cost estimations. [CHUNK_5]",
  "agency_impact": "This measure will require the establishment of a women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the Second and Fifth Circuits. [CHUNK_1] It will also require the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study. [CHUNK_2] The Judiciary and Department of Health provided comments on the measure, indicating their involvement. [CHUNK_5]",
  "economic_impact": "The committee report does not detail the economic impact of the measure. [CHUNK_5] The stated purpose is to address the individualized needs of women who are led into the criminal justice system through distinct pathways. [CHUNK_2] The program has received testimony in support from organizations including the Hawaii Substance Abuse Coalition and Community Alliance on Prisons. [CHUNK_4]",
  "policy_impact": "The measure establishes a three-year women's court pilot program in the Second and Fifth Circuits. [CHUNK_1] It also directs the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study to establish a blueprint for a future pilot program. [CHUNK_3] The Committee on Finance is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, and recommends its passage. [CHUNK_5]",
  "revenue_sources": "The Committee on Finance report does not identify or discuss any revenue sources for this measure. [CHUNK_5] The funding mechanism remains as stated in the underlying bill. [CHUNK_1]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The provided committee report does not contain information on the six-year fiscal implications. [CHUNK_5] The measure establishes a three-year women's court pilot program in the Second and Fifth Circuits. [CHUNK_1] It also requires the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study to establish a blueprint for a women's court pilot program, which will inform future costs. [CHUNK_3] The Committee on Finance is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, but does not specify any long-term funding. [CHUNK_5] The bill is recommended for Third Reading without detailed multi-year fiscal projections in this report. [CHUNK_6]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "The provided legislative documents do not indicate any anticipated impact on operating revenues. [CHUNK_5]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "The provided legislative documents do not specify any capital expenditures. [CHUNK_5]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "This committee report does not address the fiscal implications after six years. [CHUNK_5] Any long-term financial obligations would be determined after the three-year pilot program concludes and the Third Circuit completes its interim study. [CHUNK_3]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The most significant update is that the Committee on Finance report on H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, does not include any specific appropriation amounts. [CHUNK_5] While a previous committee report requested specific appropriations for the Department of Health, this report from the Committee on Finance confirms its accord with the bill's intent and recommends that it pass Third Reading without inserting any funding figures. [CHUNK_6]",
  "fte_positions": "The current committee report does not contain any reference to the creation or funding of full-time equivalent positions. [CHUNK_5]",
  "appropriations_changes": "Appropriations in H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, remain unspecified. [CHUNK_1] The Committee on Finance did not act on a previous committee's request to insert a specific dollar amount. [CHUNK_5] The committee recommends that the bill pass Third Reading with its appropriation sections remaining blank. [CHUNK_6]",
  "funding_sources_changes": "The funding source for this measure has not changed. [CHUNK_5] The committee report does not propose any alternative funding sources to the general revenues identified in the bill. [CHUNK_5]",
  "department_impact": "The departments impacted by this measure remain the same. [CHUNK_5] The pilot program is to be established in the circuit court of the Second and Fifth Circuits, and a study is required of the Third Circuit of the Judiciary. [CHUNK_2] The Department of Health also remains involved, having submitted comments on the measure. [CHUNK_5]",
  "reports_required": "The reporting requirements have not changed in this version. [CHUNK_5] The measure still requires the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study and develop a blueprint for a women's court pilot program. [CHUNK_3]",
  "pilot_program": "The pilot program's scope is unchanged. [CHUNK_1] The measure continues to establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the Second and Fifth Circuits. [CHUNK_1]",
  "sunset_date": "The sunset date for the pilot program has not been altered by this committee report. [CHUNK_5]",
  "effective_date": "The effective date for the bill has not been altered by this committee report. [CHUNK_5]"
}

chunk_details.chunk_text: HSCR1142 STAND. COM. REP. NO. 1142 Honolulu, Hawaii , 2025 RE: H.B. No. 727 H.D. 1 Honorable Nadine K. Nakamura Speaker, House of Representatives Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Madame: Your Committee on Finance, to which was referred H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, entitled: "A

which was referred H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO THE WOMEN'S COURT," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose of this measure is to: (1) Establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the Second and Fifth Circuits,

in the circuit court of the Second and Fifth Circuits, which is intended to acknowledge the distinct pathways that lead women into the criminal justice system and address their individualized needs; and (2) Require the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study

and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study to establish a blueprint for a women's court pilot program in the Third Circuit. Your Committee received testimony in support of this measure from the Office of the Public Defender; Department of the Prosecuting Attorney of the County of Maui;

Department of the Prosecuting Attorney of the County of Maui; Hawaii Substance Abuse Coalition; Community Alliance on Prisons; and nine individuals. Your Committee received testimony in opposition to this measure from one individual. Your Committee received comments on this measure from the Judiciary and Department of Health. As affirmed by

from the Judiciary and Department of Health. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Finance that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, and recommends that it pass Third
No. 727, H.D. 1, and recommends that it pass Third Reading. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee on Finance, ____________________________ KYLE T. YAMASHITA, Chair

overview.prompt: Using the provided legislative documents, statutes, and testimonies, write a clear summary describing the purpose, scope, and key components of the proposed measure or bill, including any pilot or permanent programs, reporting requirements, and sunset clauses. This should be around 3 sentences.
overview.description: General overview and summary of the measure

appropriations.prompt: Based on budgetary data and legislative appropriations, detail the funding allocated for the program or measure, including fiscal years, amounts, intended uses such as staffing, training, contracts, technology, etc... This should be around 3 sentences.

assumptions_and_methodology.prompt: Explain the assumptions, cost estimation methods, and data sources used to calculate the financial projections for this program or measure, referencing comparable programs or historical budgets where applicable. This should be around 3 sentences.

agency_impact.prompt: Describe the anticipated operational, administrative, and budgetary impact of the program or measure on the relevant government agency or department, including supervision, staffing, and resource allocation. This should be around 3 sentences.
agency_impact.description: Impact on government agencies and departments

economic_impact.prompt: Summarize the expected economic effects of the program or measure, such as cost savings, potential reductions in related expenditures, benefits to the community, and any relevant performance or participation statistics. This should be around 3 sentences.

policy_impact.prompt: Analyze the policy implications of the measure, including how it modifies existing laws or programs, its role within broader legislative strategies, and its potential effects on state or local governance. This should be around 3 sentences.

revenue_sources.prompt: Identify and describe the funding sources that will support the program or measure, such as general funds, grants, fees, or other revenue streams, based on the provided fiscal documents. This should be around 3 sentences.

six_year_fiscal_implications.prompt: Provide a multi-year fiscal outlook (e.g., six years) for the program or measure, projecting costs, staffing changes, recurring expenses, and assumptions about program expansion or permanence using available budget and workload data. This should be around 10 sentences.

operating_revenue_impact.prompt: Describe any anticipated impacts on operating revenues resulting from the program or measure, including increases, decreases, or changes in revenue streams. This should be around 3 sentences.

capital_expenditure_impact.prompt: Outline any expected capital expenditures related to the program or measure, such as investments in facilities, equipment, or technology infrastructure, based on capital budgets or agency plans. This should be around 3 sentences.

fiscal_implications_after_6_years.prompt: Summarize the ongoing fiscal obligations after the initial multi-year period for the program or measure, including annual operating costs, expected number of program sites or units, and the sustainability of funding. This should be around 3 sentences.
fiscal_implications_after_6_years.description: Long-term fiscal obligations beyond six years

updates_from_previous_fiscal_note.prompt: If you are given a previous fiscal note. Please summarize the MAIN POINTS that are different from the previous fiscal note and the new fiscal note.

fte_positions.prompt: Detail any Full Time Equivalent (FTE) positions that have been added or modified in this version of the bill, including the number of positions, their roles, and any changes from previous versions. This should be around 3 sentences.

appropriations_changes.prompt: Identify and describe any appropriations that were previously unspecified or have been modified between versions of the bill, including the amounts and purposes of the appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
appropriations_changes.description: Changes to appropriations between bill versions

funding_sources_changes.prompt: Specify the method of funding (MOF) for appropriations and identify any changes in funding sources between versions, such as shifts between general fund and special fund appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
funding_sources_changes.description: Changes to funding sources and method of funding

department_impact.prompt: Describe any changes in which department is responsible for expending appropriations, including shifts from one department to another between bill versions (e.g., from Department of Health to Judiciary). This should be around 3 sentences.
department_impact.description: Changes in department responsibility for appropriations

reports_required.prompt: Identify any reports that agencies are required to submit to the legislature, including new reporting requirements or modifications to existing ones. This should be around 3 sentences.

pilot_program.prompt: If the bill creates a pilot program, describe the length of the pilot program and whether it was initially intended to be a pilot program or a permanent program. This should be around 3 sentences.

sunset_date.prompt: Identify the sunset date for the bill or program, including any modifications to the sunset date between versions. This should be around 2 sentences.

effective_date.prompt: Identify the effective date of the bill, noting if there was a defective effective date in a previous version and what the corrected effective date is. This should be around 2 sentences.

HB727_HD1_HSCR1142_.chunk_text: HSCR1142 STAND. COM. REP. NO. 1142 Honolulu, Hawaii , 2025 RE: H.B. No. 727 H.D. 1 Honorable Nadine K. Nakamura Speaker, House of Representatives Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Madame: Your Committee on Finance, to which was referred H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, entitled: "A

which was referred H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO THE WOMEN'S COURT," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose of this measure is to: (1) Establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the Second and Fifth Circuits,

in the circuit court of the Second and Fifth Circuits, which is intended to acknowledge the distinct pathways that lead women into the criminal justice system and address their individualized needs; and (2) Require the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study

and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study to establish a blueprint for a women's court pilot program in the Third Circuit. Your Committee received testimony in support of this measure from the Office of the Public Defender; Department of the Prosecuting Attorney of the County of Maui;

Department of the Prosecuting Attorney of the County of Maui; Hawaii Substance Abuse Coalition; Community Alliance on Prisons; and nine individuals. Your Committee received testimony in opposition to this measure from one individual. Your Committee received comments on this measure from the Judiciary and Department of Health. As affirmed by

from the Judiciary and Department of Health. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Finance that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, and recommends that it pass Third
No. 727, H.D. 1, and recommends that it pass Third Reading. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee on Finance, ____________________________ KYLE T. YAMASHITA, Chair
